Validate Single Parameter

Source: R/core_parameter_registry.R
validate_param.Rd

Validates a single parameter value using the registry validation function.

Usage

validate_param(param_name, value, throw_error = TRUE)

Arguments

param_name

Character. Name of the parameter

value

Value to validate

throw_error

Logical. If TRUE, throws error on validation failure. If FALSE, returns result list

Value

If throw_error = FALSE, returns list with:

  • valid: Logical indicating if validation passed

  • message: Error message if invalid (NULL if valid)

  • normalized: Normalized value (if validation modified it, e.g., silent conversion) If throw_error = TRUE, returns normalized value or throws error

Examples

# Returns list with valid = TRUE
validate_param("word_limit", 150, throw_error = FALSE)
#> $valid
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> $message
#> NULL
#> 

# Returns list with valid = FALSE and error message
validate_param("word_limit", 1000, throw_error = FALSE)
#> $valid
#> [1] FALSE
#> 
#> $message
#> [1] "{.arg word_limit} must be between 20 and 500 (recommended range: 50-200 words)"
#> 

# Throws error
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
validate_param("word_limit", 1000, throw_error = TRUE)
} # }
